snippet: Statehouses from South Carolina to North Dakota are trying to pass bills that would call for them to ignore or resist federal measures.
abstract: At least 15 states are trying to pass bills that would let them ignore, or at least resist, any new federal restrictions to guns or high-capacity magazines within their borders; moves tap deep frustration with what conservative lawmakers call Washington's intrusion on rights of states and gun owners.
lead_paragraph: Statehouses from South Carolina to North Dakota are trying to pass bills that would call for them to ignore or resist federal measures.

headline.seo: Some States Try to Repel New Federal Gun Laws
headline.main: Some States Push Measures to Repel New U.S. Gun Laws
headline.print_headline: Some States Push Measures To Repel New U.S. Gun Laws
